com.launchdarkly.testhelpers

Class JsonAssertions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.JsonAssertions

  • public abstract class JsonAssertions
extends java.lang.Object
    Test assertions and matchers related to JSON.

    The assert methods here provide simple assertions for strings that are assumed to contain JSON.

    The other methods are factories for type-safe Hamcrest matchers. These are much more flexible, as you can use standard Hamcrest combinators like allOf or not. These use JsonTestValue as their type parameter, to prevent confusion between test code that operates on JSON strings and test code that operates on other kinds of strings. JsonTestValue is easily convertible from strings or other types; see JsonTestValue.jsonOf(String) and JsonTestValue.jsonFromValue(Object).

    Examples: 

    
     // check for the exact JSON properties {"a": 1, "b": 2} in any order
     assertThat(jsonOf(myString), jsonEquals("{\"a\":1, \"b\": 2}");
     
     // check that a JSON object's property "p" is equal to a specific boolean value
     assertThat(jsonOf(myString), jsonProperty("p", someBooleanValue));
     
     // check that a JSON object's property "p" is either null or omitted
     assertThat(jsonOf(myString),
         jsonProperty("p", anyOf(jsonNull(), jsonUndefined())));
     
     // check that a JSON object's property "p" is an array containing a specific value
     assertThat(jsonOf(myString),
         jsonProperty("p", isJsonArray(hasItem(jsonEqualsValue(someValue)))));

    When comparing unequal JSON objects or arrays, these methods will do their best to show you a localized difference such as a specific property, rather than only showing the entire actual and expected values.

    Since:
    1.1.0

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void assertJsonEquals(java.lang.String expected, java.lang.String actual)
      Parses two strings as JSON and compares them for deep equality.
      static void assertJsonIncludes(java.lang.String expected, java.lang.String actual)
      Same as assertJsonEquals(String, String) except that it allows any JSON objects in the actual data to contain extra properties that are not in the expected data.
      static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> isJsonArray(org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Iterable<? extends JsonTestValue>> elementsMatcher)
      A matcher that verifies that the input value is an array whose elements match the specified matchers.

      Equivalent to assertJsonEquals(String, String), but as a typed matcher.

      Equivalent to jsonEquals(JsonTestValue.jsonOf(expected)).

      Equivalent to jsonEquals(JsonTestValue.jsonFromValue(expected)).

      A shortcut for using jsonProperty(String, JsonTestValue) with JsonTestValue.jsonFromValue(Object).

    • Method Detail

      • assertJsonEquals

        public static void assertJsonEquals(java.lang.String expected,
                                    java.lang.String actual)
        Parses two strings as JSON and compares them for deep equality. If they are unequal, it tries to describe the difference as specifically as possible by recursing into object properties or array elements.
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected JSON string
        actual - the actual JSON string
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the values are not deeply equal, or are not valid JSON

      • jsonEquals

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonEquals(JsonTestValue expected)
        Equivalent to assertJsonEquals(String, String), but as a typed matcher.
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected JSON value
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • jsonEquals

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonEquals(java.lang.String expected)
        Equivalent to jsonEquals(JsonTestValue.jsonOf(expected)).
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected JSON as a string
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • jsonEqualsValue

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonEqualsValue(java.lang.Object expected)
        Equivalent to jsonEquals(JsonTestValue.jsonFromValue(expected)).
        Parameters:
        expected - a value that will be serialized to JSON and matched
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • assertJsonIncludes

        public static void assertJsonIncludes(java.lang.String expected,
                                      java.lang.String actual)
        Same as assertJsonEquals(String, String) except that it allows any JSON objects in the actual data to contain extra properties that are not in the expected data.
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected JSON string
        actual - the actual JSON string
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the expected values are not a subset of the actual values, or if the strings are not valid JSON

      • jsonIncludes

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonIncludes(JsonTestValue expected)
        Equivalent to assertJsonIncludes(String, String), but as a Hamcrest matcher.
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected JSON object properties
        Returns:
        a string matcher

      • jsonIncludes

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonIncludes(java.lang.String expected)
        Equivalent to jsonIncludes(JsonTestValue.jsonOf(expected)).
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected JSON as a string
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • jsonNull

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonNull()
        A matcher that verifies that the input value is a JSON null. This is equivalent to jsonEquals(JsonTestValue.jsonOf("null")).
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • jsonUndefined

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonUndefined()
        A matcher that verifies that the input value is completely undefined (as opposed to being a JSON null).
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • jsonProperty

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonProperty(java.lang.String name,
                                                               org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> matcher)
        A matcher that verifies that the input value is an object that has a property with the specified name, and that the property value matches the specified matcher.
        Parameters:
        name - the property name
        matcher - a matcher for the property value
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • jsonProperty

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonProperty(java.lang.String name,
                                                               JsonTestValue value)
        A shortcut for using jsonProperty(java.lang.String, org.hamcrest.Matcher<com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.JsonTestValue>) with jsonEquals(JsonTestValue).
        Parameters:
        name - a property name
        value - the desired value
        Returns:
        a matcher

      • jsonProperty

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<JsonTestValue> jsonProperty(java.lang.String name,
                                                               boolean value)
        A shortcut for using jsonProperty(String, JsonTestValue) with JsonTestValue.jsonFromValue(Object).
        Parameters:
        name - a property name
        value - a value that will be converted to JSON
        Returns:
        a matcher
